doc.author: Martin Necas (@mnecas)
description: Module to manage roles in oVirt/RHV.
notes: In order to use this module you have to install oVirt Python SDK. To ensure it's installed with correct version you can create the following task: I(pip: name=ovirt-engine-sdk-python version=4.4.0)

description: Defines the role as administrative-only or not.
Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:
A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates.
The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates.
If C(ca_file) parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used.
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.

compress.description: Flag indicating if compression is used for connection.

description: Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
A string containing the hostname of the server, usually something like `I(server.example.com)`.
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_HOSTNAME) environment variable.
Either C(url) or C(hostname) is required.
A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.
A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.
The password of the user.
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.

timeout.description: Number of seconds to wait for response.

description: Token to be used instead of login with username/password.
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.
A string containing the API URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`.
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.
Either C(url) or C(hostname) is required.
The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal).
Default value is set by C(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.
Description of the role.
If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.
It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
ID of the role to manage.
Name of the role to manage.
Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.
This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
List of permits which role will have
Permit 'login' is default and all roles will have it.
List can contain name of permit.
Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
Should the role be present/absent.
The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
C(yes) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

doc.short_description: Module to manage roles in oVirt/RHV

ovirt.ovirt.ovirt_role.examples:
# Examples don't contain auth parameter for simplicity,
# look at ovirt_auth module to see how to reuse authentication:

# Create administrative role with two permits
- ovirt.ovirt.ovirt_role:
    name: role
    administrative: true
    permits:
      - manipulate_permissions
      - create_instance

# Remove role
- ovirt.ovirt.ovirt_role:
    name: role
    state: absent

# Remove all permit
- ovirt.ovirt.ovirt_role:
    name: role
    administrative: ture
    permits:
      - login

ovirt_role.description: List of dictionaries describing the Roles. Role attributes are mapped to dictionary keys, all Roles attributes can be found at following url: http://ovirt.github.io/ovirt-engine-api-model/master/#types/role.
